channel.title: The Common Sense Gospel
channel.description:
The Bible was written to be understood and believed. Join us every week as we investigate and discuss what The Bible has to say about age-old spiritual questions and modern cultural issues. 

Created and hosted by Danny Simmons, Sam Tipton, and Kurt Norbut.

Email your comments and questions to commonsensegospel@yahoo.com

item.title: How Can the Church Stay Safe from Threats?
item.description: Lightning Round question 20 is about safety for the church when we are gathered together. Do we have Scriptural authority to protect ourselves and if so, what are some good ways to guarantee our safety?
item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel
item.itunes:summary: Lightning Round question 20 is about safety for the church when we are gathered together. Do we have Scriptural authority to protect ourselves and if so, what are some good ways to guarantee our safety?

item.title: 034 - More About Jesus - Mark 1:9-15
item.description: The baptism of Jesus! What an amazing day that must have been. The Son of God, baptized by His prophet who was preparing the way for Him, the Holy Spirit descending upon Him in the form of a dove, and His Father speaking from heaven. Wow!!!

item.title: Galatians 6:1-10
item.description: Let's read some beautiful verses in Galatians 6. Paul instructs the saints to help each other out of sin, to make sure and take care of the preacher who is teaching them the truth, and to continue to do good to all without losing heart.
item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel

item.title: 033 - More About Jesus - Mark 1:5-8
item.description: John the Baptist is such an important person in the life of Christ. He prepared the way of the Lord and made His paths straight. Danny and Robert will discuss John the Baptist, the man, his purpose, and his place in human history.
item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel
item.itunes:summary: John the Baptist is such an important person in the life of Christ. He prepared the way of the Lord and made His paths straight. Danny and Robert will discuss John the Baptist, the man, his purpose, and his place in human history.

item.title: Galatians 5:16-26
item.description: In this episode, Danny and Kurt will look at the works of the flesh and the fruit of the Spirit. They lust against each other and we can never walk in the flesh and in the Spirit at the same time. They are contrary to one another.
item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel

item.title: Is Gambling Sinful?
item.description: Lightning Round Question 19 is a good one! Is it sinful to gamble? Kurt will look to the word of God and apply the godly instruction that is found in His word to answer this question.
item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel

item.title: 032 - More About Jesus - Mark 1:1-4
item.description: We have finished the five major discourses of Jesus in the gospel of Matthew. Now we will step into the gospel of Mark and see the Lord as Mark portrays Him. He is both Savior and Servant in Mark. Thank you for joining us in our study of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

item.title: Galatians 5:1-15
item.description: "Stand fast therefore in the liberty by which Christ has made us free, and do not be entangled again in with a yoke of bandage. For you brethren have been called to liberty; only do not use liberty as an opportunity for the flesh, but through love serve one another." Galatians 5:1 and 13.

item.title: More About Jesus - Introduction to Mark
item.description: We have concluded the five major discourses of Matthew! In our pursuit of learning more about Jesus, we will turn to the gospel of Mark and look at the special things that he has for us concerning our Lord and Savior. We also have some exciting news about a new hymn!!!

item.title: 031 - More About Jesus - Matthew 25:31-46
item.description: As the fifth and final discourse of Jesus comes to a close, Jesus will tell us what the day of judgment will look like and what we need to know before it comes. We encourage you to be kind and to love the least of these Christ's brethren.

item.title: Galatians 4:21-31
item.description: As we move through Galatians 4, the apostle Paul will continue to show the Christians in Galatia, not only that the law won't justify them, but that the law itself shows us that there is bondage under the fleshly ordinances that are found there. He will use Abraham, Sarah, and Hagar to further explain this important truth.

item.title: What Bible Verses Can I Share with Someone Who's Depressed?
item.description: In Lightning Round Question 18, we have an excellent question about helping the people we love who may be sad or depressed. Here are some excellent passages to help you with that.

item.description: In today's episode we will read through and study the famous parable of the talents. This parable today, helps us understand what it means to be ready for His return and how we should be doing it.

item.description: We have been following the reasoning of the apostle Paul as he begs the Galatian brethren to see the error of their ways and come back to Jesus. In chapter 4, we will see him continue that plea and we will see how much he loves them and how much they love him. There is a lot of godly love in this chapter.

item.description: Jesus has been stressing to us the importance of being faithful and being ready for Him when He comes. Today, He will give us the parable of the 10 virgins and why five of them were wise and five of them were foolish.

item.description: This Lightning Round Question is a question that is often asked and discussed in many different ways. Today, Kurt will give us a Scriptural answer that will help us whenever this topic arises in daily conversation or when authority is being discussed within the Lord's church.

item.title: 028 - More About Jesus - Matthew 24:40-51
item.description: As we make our way to the end of Matthew 24, Jesus will tell us to watch and be ready! The Son of Man is coming at an hour that we do not expect. When He comes, will He find us being good stewards awaiting His return or will we be caught doing evil things, believing that He is delaying his coming?

item.description: As we listen to Paul present this beautiful defense of Christ and His gospel, it will be very important to remember that sometimes a false doctrine can be presented with great confidence and emotion, but that doesn't make it right.

Danny and Robert truly want to thank everyone who has been listening to this study about Jesus, as we move through the five major discourses of Jesus in the book of Matthew.

item.description: Season 8 is dedicated to the book of Galatians. In this chapter, we will watch the apostle Paul further develop the truth of the gospel as it pertains to salvation by faith in Christ and the erroneous teaching of the Judaizers who came to Galatia from Jerusalem.

item.title: 026 - More About Jesus - Matthew 24:15-28
item.description: In this episode, Jesus will go into greater detail concerning Jerusalem and the abomination of desolation that was prophesied in the book of Daniel. Come study with Danny and Robert and let us strive to understand more about Jesus.

item.title: Galatians 1
item.description: Season 8 is well on its way, so we will start this episode by reading through the first chapter of Galatians. The apostle Paul is amazed that these brethren have turned from the gospel of Christ. Their acceptance of a perverted version has sent him over the edge. Let's listen closely to the mistake they made and do all that we can to avoid this error ourselves.

item.title: Season Eight Is Here!!!
item.description: Danny and Kurt have decided to change things up a bit and simply read through a book of the Bible. Galatians is such a deep and powerful letter and there is no doubt concerning it's eternal nature and message. Paul will warn all of us about the dangers of tampering with the gospel of Christ and tolerating those who insist on doing it. Galatians 1:6 " I marvel that you are turning away so soon from Him who called you in the grace of Christ, to a different gospel."

item.title: How Do I Handle Transgender Concerns?
item.description: We received a very important and timely question from one of our listeners. Thank you for sending this question to us. The question is, "If God made each of us and God doesn’t make mistakes, how do you resolve that my family member/child/sibling/cousin was born female but feels more like a male?"

item.title: 025 - More about Jesus - Matthew 24:1-14
item.description: Here in Matthew 24, Jesus will change His tone and His teaching. Now that He has left the temple, His disciples have gathered to Him and have asked three very important questions. "When will these things be? What will be the sign of Your coming? And what will be the sign of the end of the age?"

item.title: Christ Before Bethlehem
item.description: Jesus is deity! He is the third Person in the triune Godhead, and we should not think of Him as One who came into existence at His birth. John 1:1-3 makes it plain. "In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. He was in the beginning with God. All things were made through Him, and without Him nothing was made that was made."

item.title: 024 - More About Jesus - Matthew 23:25-39
item.description: In this episode, Jesus will finish the pronouncement of His eight woes upon the scribes and the Pharisees. They have played the hypocrite, and it is time for the world to know. The chapter concludes with the lament of Jesus, over the city of Jerusalem.

item.title: 023 - More About Jesus - Matthew 23:17-24
item.description: As we continue to read through Matthew 23, we are listening carefully to Jesus as He pronounces eight woes against the scribes and the Pharisees. They are hypocrites, and on this day the Lord will take off their masks and expose them for who they really are. Let's be sure not to make the same mistakes as they did.

item.title: The Old Man vs. The New Man
item.description:
In Romans 6:6, Paul says, "Knowing this, that our old man was crucified with Him, that the body of sin might be done away with, that we should no longer be slaves of sin."

There are many places in the New Testament where this idea of the old man and the new man are illustrated. In each of these we see godly instruction given, so that all Christians will know who they ought to be in Christ.

item.title: 022 - More About Jesus - Matthew 23:13-16
item.description: Though the scribes and the Pharisees were publicly revered by the people, they were privately corrupt. As they proved themselves to be masters of appearance before men, they were turning their backs on God and His will for their own lives.

item.title: Proverbial Wisdom - Proverbs 17
item.description: Proverbs 17 is one of Danny's favorite chapters in the book. In this episode, Danny and Robert will discuss the precious gems of truth that are found in Proverbs 17 and how we can use the wisdom of Solomon to better our own lives and the lives of everyone around us.

item.title: 022 - More About Jesus - Matthew 23:1-12
item.description: Ladies and Gentlemen, we have made it to the final discourse of Jesus in the gospel of Matthew. Jesus has told all of Israel the truth about heaven, His Father, and His Father's will for their lives. Now it is time to speak clearly and openly about the Scribes and the Pharisees. This message will push them over the edge, but Jesus will always tell the truth about our condition before God and what we must do about it. We love Him for that.

item.description: Today we are blessed to have Buddy Payne returning for another Bible discussion. This time we'll talk about walking in the light and how that can be practically applied in our daily lives.

item.title: 021 - More About Jesus - Matthew 18:21-35
item.description: As Jesus' fourth major discourse comes to a close, Jesus will give us the parable of the unforgiving servant. The point of this parable is to show us that when God forgives us, He fully expects us to be people who forgive. Grace and mercy that is measured by men, is not divine.

item.title: Proverbial Wisdom - Serene Speech
item.description: Today we have Robert Moore joining us for all that the book of Proverbs has to say about our speech and the use of our tongues. God expects us to be careful with our words and use our tongues to bless those around us. "Let your speech always be with grace, seasoned with salt, that you may know how you ought to answer each one." Colossians 4:6

item.title: 020 - More About Jesus - Matthew 18:10-20
item.description: In these verses, Jesus continues to explain the value of "little ones" in His kingdom. He will tell His disciples how important they are to God and that we should not despise them. Instead of despising them do this, "If your brother sins against you, go and tell him his fault between you and him alone. If he hears you, you have gained your brother."

item.description: This is a big question today, as it has been since Jesus was born of a virgin. Danny and Kurt will look at the New Testament and discuss what is revealed about the last days, and what we should be doing about it.

item.title: How Can I Be a Better Father?
item.description: Lightning Round question 15 is an emotional one for sure. The question is, "I'm on my fifties and my son is in his twenties. I have not always been a good father, and was absent during some important times in his life. How can I be a better father today, and how can I heal some of the damage that's been done?"

item.title: 014 - More About Jesus - Matthew 12:46-50

item.title: Where Are the Nine?
item.description: When Jesus entered a certain city, ten lepers came near to Him and said, "Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!" Jesus did have mercy on all of them but only one returned to give thanks to God. This is the very reason that Jesus asks this very important question.

item.description: "Judge not, that you be not judged." This is a commandment from Jesus that we will hear and consider today. What does Jesus mean? item.title: Melchizedek
item.description: This man does not fill much of the space that is found in the Bible. We see him once in Genesis 14 when he speaks to Abraham and there is one verse in the Psalms that mention his name. Danny and Kurt will look at God's glorious work in this seemingly unimportant man named Melchizedek. He plays an important role in the Priesthood of Jesus!

item.title: A Beginners Approach to the Bible
item.description: There are many people who would like to begin reading the Bible, but they just don't know where to start. Danny and Kurt will try to address those challenges and share some experiences that have proven to be helpful to them in their walk with God. If you are beginning to read God's word, may He bless you and keep you as His wondrous glory and Almighty power is revealed to the one, He loves so much. You!

item.title: Encouraging Words 1 Peter 5:5-6
item.description: "Humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God and He will exalt you in due time." This is such a beautiful passage from the word of God. Some people think that being humble means being weak, but it doesn't mean that at all. Godly humility means that we are submissive to our King, and we are trying to be more like Him each day.

item.title: Starting A Conversation
item.description: We know from reading our Bibles that the Christians who were persecuted in Jerusalem were scattered across the region and they went about preaching the word (Acts 8:4). Danny and Kurt discuss the fact that though we are not under persecution, we are free to talk about God and His word, and yet, many of us are not likely to preach the gospel to others. Why is that and what are some good ways to start that wonderful conversation?

item.title: Peeling Off the Label
item.description: The world is content with putting labels on everyone. Labels in society are typically used to define individual people by their race, social status, and even their position at work. Unfortunately, labels are used all the time in the religious world. Danny and Kurt discuss the dangers of labeling people who are different, and how it can cause more harm than good.

item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever had a question about God or the Bible that was very difficult to answer? Have you carried a strong objection to what God has told us, maybe even for a very long time. We have Ben Schneider with us to look into that very issue. What happens when we have an understandable objection and what is the right way to properly investigate that objection?

item.title: Encouraging Words Colossians 1:27-29
item.description: Today we'll look at the word, "warning" in the Bible and consider what it means to be warned by God. We know that He wants what is best and He wants us to know the truth. How will we respond when the warning is sounded?
item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel
item.itunes:summary: Today we'll look at the word, "warning" in the Bible and consider what it means to be warned by God. We know that He wants what is best and He wants us to know the truth. How will we respond when the warning is sounded?

item.title: Bonus Session - Encouraging Preaching - Mark Roberts
item.description: We are very excited to have Mark Roberts with us from Irving, Texas. Mark is well known across the country for being an eloquent man, competent in the Scriptures. Today we sit down with Mark and ask him some of the questions that Danny has wanted to ask him for a long time. ENJOY!!!

item.title: Encouraging Words Philippians 2:1-4
item.description: In this short episode, Paul gives us some wonderful words of encouragement and instruction. "In lowliness of mind, let each esteem others better than himself." This is God's will for our lives.
item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel
item.itunes:summary: In this short episode, Paul gives us some wonderful words of encouragement and instruction. "In lowliness of mind, let each esteem others better than himself." This is God's will for our lives.

item.title: Be Patient
item.description: In this episode, Danny will admit that he lacks patience in many ways and Kurt will do his very best to help him with that. God is patient and He commands us to be patient. God is in control of all things, so trusting in Him and waiting on His goodness and forbearance is the best way for us to live our lives.

item.title: Encouraging Words Revelation 21:4
item.description: In this episode, Danny explores the powerful promise in Revelation 21:4. God will wipe away every tear from our eyes. How beautiful heaven must be!
item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Danny explores the powerful promise in Revelation 21:4. God will wipe away every tear from our eyes. How beautiful heaven must be!

item.title: A Christians' Voter Guide
item.description: Who will you vote for this time around? Will you vote at all? Does God care about the way that we vote and what party we associate with? Danny and Kurt will discuss some of these important questions and the many challenges that come from investigating candidates and making a godly decision at the polls.

item.title: Encouraging Words Proverbs 28:13
item.description: Our encouraging word is from Solomon, He gives us the wisdom of God that will always be true. "He who covers his sin will not prosper, but he who confesses and forsakes them will have mercy."
item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel
item.itunes:summary: Our encouraging word is from Solomon, He gives us the wisdom of God that will always be true. "He who covers his sin will not prosper, but he who confesses and forsakes them will have mercy."

item.title: Your Gentle Spirit
item.description: In this episode, Danny and Kurt will talk to all of you about your gentle spirit and what an amazing gift your gentle spirit is to the world around you. Galatians 6:1 says, "Brethren, if any man is overtaken in any trespass, you who are spiritual restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness..."

item.title: Encouraging Words Philippians 4:13
item.description:
*Danny said that Pilgrim's Progress was written by "Paul" Bunyan. It's actually, John Bunyan. Sorry!

"I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me." What does this verse really mean and how can we all be encouraged by what it teaches. Let's find out together!

item.title: Living In the Asylum
item.description: Today, we live in a world that is eager to accept all sorts of insanity. We often wonder how these strange ideas are even being considered or entertained, and yet, they are. It feels like we are all living in an asylum. Danny and Kurt will discuss this topic and more importantly, they will look at what God has to say about it.

item.title: Swordsmanship
item.description: A couple of weeks ago, we watched Peter pull out his physical sword and cut off a man's ear. Jesus promptly told him to put it away. Today, we will watch Jesus give Peter a new sword! Danny and Kurt will talk about this new sword and how powerful it really is.

item.title: Encouraging Words Proverbs 22:6
item.description: Train up a child in the way he should go and when he is old he will not depart from it.

item.title: Spiritual Math
item.description: Inspired by the Holy Spirit, Peter presents us with a significant math problem to apply in our lives. Fear not, it involves merely addition! The challenge lies in solving the problem in such a manner that we "show our work," just as our teachers would instruct.

item.title: Encouraging Words Proverbs 15:30
item.description: How will you use your eyes today? It is our deepest hope that you will share the light of your eyes to those around you and cause them to rejoice with you because they know you have something special in God and in His love!

item.title: Bonus Session - Marriage - Mark Broyles
item.description: We are so happy to have Mark Broyles with us in this episode. Mark has been a faithful gospel preacher for many years and is well known for his sermon series on marriage. We'll spend some time with him and get his special insights to the sacred union that is sanctified by God.

item.title: Encouraging Words 2 Corinthians 3:1-3
item.description: We pray that you are encouraged by this beautiful passage. Those who serve the Lord are His written epistle. They are sharing God's love and truth with the world around them.

item.title: You Have Fallen From Grace
item.description: In Galatians 5, Paul warns the saints in Galatia that if they attempt to be justified by the law; they have fallen from grace. Danny and Kurt discuss the meaning and purpose of this warning and how this passage flies in the face of Calvinism.

item.title: Encouraging Words Luke 15:18-19
item.description: God patiently waits for all of his wandering children to come to their senses and return to Him. It is always wrong to walk away from God and His eternal love, but if we ever do, He will receive us again to Himself. If we'll only repent and return.

item.title: A Backslider We All Know
item.description: In this episode, Danny and Kurt talk about a backslider that is familiar to everyone. We all know him, and we all have watched him backslide at some point in our lives. Who is it? You'll have to find out for yourself. Thank you for listening and for your interest in spiritual things.

item.title: Encouraging Words Ephesians 2:14-18
item.description: I have prayed that each one of you will be encouraged by this episode of Encouraging Words. We have a relationship with each other that is accomplished and protected by God. May you see all of God's children as your dearest of friends and may you strive to strengthen them today.

item.description: "Give ear to my words, O LORD, consider my meditation. Give heed to the voice of my cry, my King and my God, for to You I will pray." Psalm 5:1-2

item.description: Today, we'll think about the words of Jesus as He prayed to His Father on the night of His trial. He loves you so much and He asks God that we might be glorified with Him after He fulfills His work on earth. Hallelujah! What a Savior!

item.description: In our episode this week, Danny and Kurt talk about the reality of America's spiritual condition and some of the reasons that Americans have little use for God's word. What is the cause of this and what can be done about it?

item.title: Encouraging Words Galatians 6:7-9
item.description: We hope that you are encouraged to know that you will reap that which you have sown. It's always a good time for us to reflect and think about the seed that we are planting in the field of life. May you all be encouraged by this passage from the word of God.

item.title: Lessons from Our Parents
item.description: What were some of the things your parents taught you? Can you remember some of the great things they did and said that made you who you are today? Can you also remember some of the mistakes they made while raising you? In this episode Danny and Kurt will look at all of our parents and see what great lessons we can take away from their lives.

item.title: Encouraging Words Luke 13:12
item.description: Our Wonderful Counselor and Savior sees each on of us, He knows what we need, and He knows how to provide for those needs. Today, we watch Jesus heal a woman who has been bent over for eighteen years!

item.title: The Israel of God
item.description: In Galatians 6:16 Paul refers to the church as the Israel of God. Danny and Kurt will explore this title and the reason behind it.

item.title: We're Not Worthy
item.description: In Revelation 5, we read of a strong angel who cries out, "Who is worthy to open the scroll and loose it's seals?" There is only One and Danny and Kurt will talk about Him who is found worthy in heaven, on earth, and under the earth.

item.title: Bonus Session - Biblical Evidences - John Evans
item.description: Starting a conversation with those who may not believe in the God of the Bible can be very difficult. In this episode, John Evans shares some great ways to reach those who may disagree with our faith. John has done a great deal of study and research on this topic and is a great resource for those who need a little help speaking to friends and family.

item.title: Little Sins - Part 2
item.description:
What about those little sins? Are they important and what is the best Scriptural way to address these pesky problems. Danny and Kurt discuss this issue and offer some helpful solutions to those little sins that need to be removed.

item.title: Little Sins
item.description: In response to a request, Danny spends a few minutes looking at the idea of those little sins that may be harder for us to eliminate in our lives. What does the Bible say about that and what can we do to make sure that we are right with God, even in the smallest of matters.

item.title: "Lip Fruit" - Congregational Singing
item.description: All joking aside, Hebrews 13:15 tells us that the sacrifice of praise that we offer to God is the fruit of our lips and we are giving thanks to His name. Danny and Kurt will discuss the singing that the church is called to do and some of the innerworkings of that commandment.

item.title: Forest Fire from Hell
item.description: In James 3 we are told that the tongue is set on fire by hell. See what a great forest a little fire kindles. Danny and Kurt will use their tongues to discuss that dangerous little body part and how damaging it can be. When used wisely, it can also be a blessed gift.

item.title: The Lord's Church - Part 2
item.description: This week Danny and Kurt will focus on the local church in Austin and discuss the many moving parts in the body of Christ and the rich blessings that come from a congregation where every part does its share. Ephesians 4:16

item.title: The Lord's Church - Part 1
item.description: Danny and Kurt are very excited to share the work of the Lord's church as it is given to us in the New Testament. The church is the glorious work of God, and it is His desire that we all be a part of it and that we are all working within that body. 1 Peter 2:4-5

item.title: Don't Ever Give Up!
item.description: Danny and Kurt discuss the challenge that all believers face when it comes to friends and family that have not obeyed the gospel. How can we help? What should we say? When have we said too much? They will share their thoughts on these important questions.

item.title: Abaddon, the Great Dragon
item.description: In Revelation 9:11 he is called Abaddon and in Revelation 12:9 he is called the great dragon who deceives the whole world. Danny and Kurt discuss the devil and what the Scriptures teach on our malignant foe. He is very real, and he is seeking whom he may devour. 1 Peter 5:8

item.title: Immutable
item.description: What an amazing word to use when we are talking about Almighty God! He is omnipotent, omniscient, all powerful and immutable. Danny and Kurt will discuss this important description of the Lord and how easy it is to see the attribute in His word.

item.title: Finding Peace
item.description: In John 14:27 Jesus tells His disciples, "Peace, I leave with you. Not as the world gives do I give to you. Let not your hearts be troubled, neither let them be afraid." As Danny and Kurt discuss this promise from the Lord, we can realize together that perfect peace is found in God and all that He has done.

item.title: What Must I Do?
item.description: There are several occasions in the New Testament where a person asks the very important question, "What must I do?" Danny and Kurt will look at some of those moments and discuss their great importance. It is in these moments that the lost sinner gets to hear about God's solution for sin.

item.title: A Blind Man Sees His Savior
item.description: We meet an amazing man in John 9. One of our all-time favorite accounts of a person who met Jesus, the way he responded to Him, and his response to the religious leaders in Jerusalem. This man knows one thing about the Lord, and he is able to reach the necessary conclusion on this one thing. "One thing I know: that though I was blind, now I see!"

item.description: The tremendous love of God has been poured out into our hearts and Peter helps us understand how much time and effort has been dedicated the gospel message that we all love and enjoy. The prophecies of God were not for the prophets, they were for YOU!

item.title: How Jesus Handles Doubt
item.description: Doubt can be spiritually debilitating. We all face it, and we all know how strong it can be when it comes to trusting in the Lord and being reassured that He cares. Danny and Kurt will discuss the darkness that doubt can bring, and they will see how Jesus deals with doubt.

item.description: This is the third and final episode out of the three "Reflections of Jesus". In this podcast Danny and Kurt look at David and the many reflections of Jesus that are found in his life. There are so many!!!

Thank you for joining us in this wonderful study of our Lord and King.

item.title: Questions from Jesus - Why Do You Call Me Good?
item.description: Danny and Kurt will look at another question from Jesus. When the rich young ruler comes to Jesus, he asks Him, "Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?" We will look at Jesus response and the question that He asks. "Why do you call Me good?"

item.title: God's Compassionate Judgment
item.description: There are times in our daily Bible reading that we may think the Lord has been too harsh with someone in His judgment. Or that He may simply find joy in destroying a people or a nation. Danny and Kurt will look at this common conclusion and why it is not true. "The Divine longsuffering waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was being prepared..." 1 Peter 3:20

item.title: The Faith of Abraham
item.description: In this episode, Danny and Kurt look at the faith of Abraham and the faith of Isaac. Both of these men show tremendous faith as they make their way up to mountain to offer this sacrifice. God has commanded it, and we'll watch them move forward to do all the He has said.

item.title: Be Careful How You Walk
item.description: In Paul's letter to the Ephesians, he reminds them to walk worthy of the gospel and always be mindful of the way that they walk. Danny and Kurt discuss this godly instruction and how it should be of first priority to all of us who love the Lord.

item.title: Lessons from a Thief
item.description: In this episode, Danny and Kurt discuss the brief moments in the life of the thief on the cross that are recorded for us in Scripture. What great lessons we can take from him, from his confession, and from the assurance of his salvation.

item.title: Encouraging Words 2 Samuel 12:22-23
item.description: After David's baby dies, he goes to the house of the Lord and worships. His servants ask him why he fasted and wept while the baby was alive and now, he is eating and worshipping. David's response is so encouraging because he understands the promises of God and believes them with all of his heart.

item.description: It can be very difficult trying to answer someone who opposes the Bible and what it teaches. Kurt has spent a good amount of time learning some of the popular questions that come from skeptics and the best ways to answer those questions. We hope this episode is helpful to all of you.

item.title: Encouraging Words Proverbs 17:6
item.description: Today's encouraging word is dedicated to our grandparents. Thank you for the blessing that you are to your family and thank you for all that you provide to your children. Proverbs 17:6 "Children's children are the crown of old men, ..."

item.title: Mastering Your Money
item.description: If you don't have control over your money, your money will have control over you. Being in debt is one of the worst things that can happen to us in this world because the weight of debt will crush everything we care about and everything we should be focused on. Danny and Kurt discuss the great pressures that come from being in debt and what God has told us about these things.

item.title: Samson - Part 3
item.description: In this final episode of the life of Samson, Danny and Kurt will look at the end of his life and the great temptation that plagued him throughout. He is a difficult character to understand and yet there are many lessons we can learn from this man, Samson.

item.title: Samson - Part 2
item.description: Samson will continue to be a serious problem for the Philistines. In chapter 15, Danny and Kurt discuss the overwhelming strength of Samson as he faces the Philistines and continues to kill the enemy of God's people.

item.title: Samson - Part 1
item.description: Samson is one of the most interesting characters in the Bible. He is a physical force, he is compulsive, infatuated with women, and he seems to be very naive when it comes to relationships. Danny and Kurt will discuss this man's character, his victories, and his failures as he lives out his life during the time of the Judges.

item.title: Encouraging Words Romans 6:23
item.description: Romans 6:23 tells us the truth about our sin and how we can be freed from it. Because God loves us, He has told us about the reality of death and that it is the payment for sin. The world uses doublespeak to distort bad news, the Lord does not. Praise God for His truth!

item.title: The Resurrection - Part 5 - Why It Matters
item.description:
Danny and Kurt will wrap up their resurrection series with one very important point. Why it matters. The Bible shows us that it matters to God, His Son, and His Holy Spirit. Let's look at why it matters to you, today, right where you are.

"And if Christ is not risen, your faith is futile; you are still in your sins." 1 Corinthians 15:17

item.description: We have a special guest this podcast! Ellen McGuyer is a member of the church, a loving wife and mother, and one of the kindest people you could ever meet. She is joining Danny to discuss an important topic that is often misrepresented and misunderstood. We hope you enjoy this intriguing conversation about the order of things.

item.description: In this fourth part of our resurrection series Danny and Kurt will look at the opposing arguments against the resurrection and the reality of its truth. There have many people through the years who have opposed the supernatural work that God accomplished in raising His Son from the dead. Today, we will consider what the opposition has said.

item.description: As we go through our resurrection study, its important role in the gospel message, and the power that God has displayed by its accomplishment, Danny and Kurt consider the evidence that we have to verify the truth of it all.

item.title: Encouraging Words John 12:41
item.description: In John 12:41 we are told that Isaiah prophesied these things when he saw the glory of the Lord and spoke of Him. It is an amazing thing to read Isaiah 6 and get a glimpse of what Isaiah saw and how he responded to it. This King on His throne in the temple was Jesus!

item.title: The Resurrection - Part 2 - Old Testament Prophecy
item.description: In the resurrection - Part 2, Danny and Kurt will look at the many Old Testament prophecies and the words of Jesus concerning the way in which He would be glorified. God gave these prophets the words to say, and they did not understand how it would all come to pass. Here, in the New Testament era, we do understand what God has done.

item.title: Encouraging Words 1 Timothy 6:6
item.description: "Now godliness with contentment is great gain." Everyone is looking for "great gain" and the word of God has told us where it is and how to find it. It is encouraging to read and understand this passage and is even greater to live it out.

item.title: The Resurrection - Part 1 - The Heart of the Gospel
item.description: The resurrection of Jesus is mentioned in every recorded sermon in the book of Acts. Christ's resurrection is central to all New Testament doctrine. Danny and Kurt discuss the power of the resurrection and why it is central to all of the teaching in the New Testament.

item.title: Tough Love
item.description: In this episode, Danny and Kurt discuss the sin of enabling. It is wrong to enable others to continue in sin. The word of God is clear on this matter. We should never help others while they sin. Instead, we are to, "Rebuke those who are sinning in the presence of all, that the rest also may fear." 1 Timothy 5:20

item.title: Encouraging Words John 5:39
item.description: In John 5:39, Jesus says that the Scriptures testify of Him. This is the evidence He provides to show that God has sent Him. Today, we will look at compound probability and discuss what the Scriptures say about Jesus and how they prove Him to be the Messiah.

item.title: Justified
item.description: In Romans 1, the Holy Spirit shows us that we are justified by faith. God has done this by His own will, it is not from us. "Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness." Romans 4:3. In this episode, Danny and Kurt will look at justification by faith and what else the Bible has to say about it.

item.title: Encouraging Words Luke 14:23
item.description:
In the parable of the great supper, Jesus tells us about the three excuses that men gave so they wouldn't have to come to the feast.

Be encouraged, you have an invitation from God, and you can choose to accept it, and sit at His table.

"These things I have written to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, that you may know that you have eternal life, and that you may continue to believe in the Son of God." 1 John 5:13.

item.description: This encouraging word is mostly about home plate. How big is home plate? Is it the same size for every baseball league and for all ages? We answer that question today.

item.title: Encouraging Words Ephesians 6:10-11
item.description: We are at war with the devil. Please be encouraged by the truth that sets men free and by the love that is required to tell the truth. We are in a spiritual war but knowing that allows us to be aware of it and to choose the side that wins!

item.title: Oil Change Due
item.description: When our "check engine" light comes on, most of us will check our engines, find out what is wrong, and do whatever it takes to make it right. It's sad to see how far some will go for the maintenance and upkeep of earthly things, while neglecting the spiritual and eternal things which are far more important.

item.description: It doesn't get more encouraging than this! Rejoice in the Lord always. Again, I will say rejoice!

item.title: Sin Is Spiritual Leprosy
item.description: There is a powerful parallel between sin and leprosy. Both of them will kill us, they desensitize us, and they can both be spotted and cleansed. Danny and Kurt talk about these very interesting similarities that are shared by sin and leprosy.

item.title: Encouraging Words Acts 10:33
item.description: Our encouraging words come from Cornelius, the centurion. Knowing that Peter was coming to present God's will, Cornelius invited his friends and relatives so that they too could hear and understand the word of God. One of the most encouraging things we can do is to invite our friends and relatives to come and hear the good news proclaimed.

Thank you!

item.title: Encouraging Words 1 Samuel 10:7
item.description: Let's consider this beautiful and encouraging verse from the Old Testament. This is where Samuel tells Saul, "Do as the occasion demands, for God is with you." What an encouraging thing to hear!

item.title: Living Sacrifices
item.description: In 2 Samuel 24, Araunah offered all the things needed for David to make a sacrifice to God. David famously replied, "No, but I will surely buy it from you for a price; nor will I offer burnt offerings to the LORD my God with that which costs me nothing." There are some things that are very important to us, that we'll need to give up in order to serve and please God. That is true sacrifice.

item.title: Encouraging Words 1 Corinthians 15:19
item.description: One of the most important things for each one of us to know and believe is that Christ is risen from the dead. Paul has devoted his Christian life to this truth and in 1 Corinthians 15:19 he explains that if he is wrong about the resurrection, then he is the most pitiable of all men.

item.title: The Crucifixion - Part 5 - Jesus at Calvary
item.description:
In the final episode of this series, Danny and Kurt spend some time with Jesus at Calvary. What a Savior! What a friend! We'll watch the love of Christ, freely given to the world as He willingly offers Himself to God on the cross. Our debt has been paid in full.


A special thank you to Ben and Kaiden Schneider, as well as Todd Foster for their willingness to help us with the final skit.

item.title: Encouraging Words 1 Corinthians 2:7-8
item.description: The wisdom of God has been shared with the whole world! God has shown us that He has chosen the weak things of the world to put to shame the mighty and He has done all of this through His Son. "He who glories, let him glory in the Lord!"

item.title: The Crucifixion - Part 4 - The Trial
item.description: The elders and the chief priests will finally get their way. After several frustrating attempts, trying to get Jesus apart from the crowd, they now have Him right where they want Him. Bound, hidden away in the dark, facing a kangaroo court that will not allow a fair trial. Let's watch our Lord and Savior together as He stands before these wicked men, in accordance with His Father's will.

item.description: Jesus is seated at the right hand of the Father and makes intercession for us! What an amazing thing to know what our Savior is doing on our behalf, while we strive to enter through the narrow gate. "In My Father's house are many mansions, if it were not so, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you." John 14:2

item.description: These encouraging words help us to see the importance of our obedience to God. Jesus obeyed His Father in all things. The cross makes that more clear than anything else, but Jesus always did what God had given Him to do. Be encouraged by the words of Christ in John 14:30-31.

item.title: Encouraging Words 1 John 2:6
item.description: What an amazing verse! If we say that we abide in Jesus, then we ought to walk as He walked. He is our Savior, our Redeemer, and our Friend. He has given us the perfect example to follow as we live out our lives for God. In John 13:15 Jesus says, "I have given you an example, that you should do as I have done to you."

item.title: A+O=R
item.description: A Plus O Equals R. What does that mean? Danny and Kurt will discuss this old formula, how it is used in the church, and what it means for each of us today.

item.title: God Is Calling
item.description: Did you know that God is calling you. He is calling out to each one of us. Psalm 19:2-3 says this, "Day to day pours out speech, and night to night reveals knowledge. there is no speech, nor are there words, whose voice is not heard." God speaks to all of us through His creation, but He certainly speaks in other ways as well. Danny and Kurt will discuss the way the Lord speaks to us and what He is saying.

item.title: Encouraging Words Matthew 22:29
item.description: The Sadducees have come up with a very difficult question that they want Jesus to answer. They have made the terrible mistake of trying to make God's word fit what they already believe, and Jesus will show them the error in that approach. He will say to them, "You are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures not the power of God."

item.description: The Lord's church should always be looking for godly men in their midst who would be qualified to serve as elders and deacons. In this episode, Danny and Kurt take a close look at deacons, and the qualifications that are given by the Holy Spirit.

item.description: "What is your Beloved more than these?" This question is asked of the Shulamite woman who was searching for her beloved. She was so in love that she knew the answer to that question and was determined to tell others. Friend, when you are asked about Jesus, how do you respond?

item.title: Trusting the New Testament
item.description: Some believe that the Bible was simply written by men. Others believe it is inspired by God (2 Timothy 3:16). Danny and Kurt will look at this age old debate and discuss the New Testament, how it came to be, and the claims that are made within its letters.
item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel
item.itunes:summary: Some believe that the Bible was simply written by men. Others believe it is inspired by God (2 Timothy 3:16). Danny and Kurt will look at this age old debate and discuss the New Testament, how it came to be, and the claims that are made within its letters.

item.title: Encouraging Words Luke 21:34-36
item.description: In this passage, Jesus tells us that the Day of the Lord will come as a snare on all those who dwell on the face of the whole earth. As disheartening as that sounds, we'll look at the positive side of that message. If we watch faithfully for Him and are steadfast in prayer, we will be counted worthy.
item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel

item.title: Three Rounds with Satan
item.description:
"Simon, Simon! Indeed, Satan has asked for you, that he may sift you as wheat." Luke 22:31

Before His betrayal and arrest in the garden, Jesus warned Peter that he was going to be tested by Satan. Peter will be challenged that night to stand with Jesus during His trial. Satan attacks him three times and Danny and Kurt will discuss those three attacks and the way Peter responded to them.

item.title: Encouraging Words Luke 7:13
item.description: Jesus, the Son of God is the Prince of Life! We will watch Him raise the widows son at Nain in Luke 7:11-17. Praise God!

item.title: Deceit
item.description: A person who is deceitful is one who tries to convince others to accept something as valid and true that is actually invalid and false. Danny and Kurt will discuss this topic and look at what the Lord has to say about it. "Diverse weights and diverse measures are both alike, an abomination to the LORD." Proverbs 20:10

item.title: God's Thoughts Toward You
item.description: In 1 Timothy 2:3-4 Paul tells Timothy, "For this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Savior, who desires all men to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth." In this verse, we can see God's desire for every single person who has ever lived. His thoughts are favorable toward us, He loves us, and He wants us to know the truth about Him and His Son. Danny and Kurt will discuss this amazing fact and how many different times the Lord tells us about His thoughts towards us.

item.title: Things God Cannot Do
item.description: That's right! There a few things that the Bible tells us God cannot do. As stange as that sounds, that Almighty, all knowing, omnipotent, and omnipresent God has some things that He cannot do, and He has told us what they are. Danny and Kurt will talk about those few things and discuss what it means for us.

item.title: Bitterness and Envy
item.description: God has warned us about harboring bitterness and envy in our hearts. It is so destructive and it hurts everyone involved. Danny and Kurt will look at those in the Bible who were bitter and envious, and we will consider a few of those stellar characters that chose not to be. "But if you have bitter envy and self-seeking in your hearts, do not boast against the truth." James 3:14

item.title: Heaven
item.description: We have three great questions that were submitted to our Bible Question Box, and they all deal with the same subject. Danny and Kurt will answer those questions on this podcast. What is heaven? What does heaven look like? What will I look like in heaven?

item.title: Encouraging Words Joshua 1:9
item.description: In Joshua 1:9 the Lord tells Joshua to be strong and courageous. In this short podcast, Danny and Kurt will look at this commandment and discuss how we can be strong and courageous, no matter what is happening in our lives.

item.title: Calling On the Name of the Lord
item.description: Today, Danny and Kurt discuss the phrase, "calling in the name of the Lord" that is found in Scripture. What does it mean, how is it used in the Bible, and how does it help us in our walk with the Lord? To our listeners, thank you so much for your interest in spiritual things. You are an encouragement to us.

item.title: Encouraging Words John 16:33
item.description: These are marvelous words that are spoken by our Savior! In John 16:33 Jesus tells his apostles, "Be of good cheer, I have overcome the world." We hope that you are encouraged by these eternal words of love.

item.title: The Watchman's Warning
item.description: God told Ezekiel that if he did not warn the children of Israel, their blood would be on his head when they die in their iniquity. Danny and Kurt discuss this instruction from God and what it means for us. "So you, son of man: I have made you a watchman for the house of Israel; therefore you shall hear a word from My mouth and warn them for Me." Ezekiel 33:7

item.title: Does He Thank That Servant?
item.description: In Luke 17, Jesus tells his apostles that if their brother sins against them seven times in one day and repents of those sins each time, they should forgive every time. The apostles respond by saying, "Increase our faith." This is when Jesus explains the relationship between the servant and the master. 'Does the master thank that servant after he has done all that he was commanded to do?" I think not.

item.title: The Pillar and Ground of the Truth
item.description: In 1 Timothy 3:15, the apostle Paul refers to the church of the living God as the, "Pillar and Ground of the Truth". From this passage alone, we can see the important role that the church plays in its service to God. Danny and Kurt will discuss the role that the church plays in this world and what God has given her to do.

item.title: Isaiah 53
item.description: One of the greatest Messianic prophecies in the Old Testament is found in Isaiah 53. This chapter looks at the crucifixion of Jesus through the eyes of believer. Each one of us is also seen and prophesied of in this prophecy. "All we like sheep have gone astray; We have turned, every one, to his own way; And the LORD has laid on Him, the iniquity of us all." Isaiah 53:6

A very young man in Shilo who has given his heart and his service to the true and living God. What a great example he is for us and what a wonderful thing it is to speak as Samuel spoke in his youth. "Speak Lord, for your servant heareth."

item.description: Children are truly a blessing! Psalm 127:3 says, "Behold, children are a heritage from the LORD, the fruit of the womb is a reward." This tells us that children are a gift from God and we as parents, are stewards over their lives. Danny and Kurt will discuss this great blessing and great responsibility in part one of this episode.

item.title: I'll Do Better Today
item.description: There should be a strong desire in each one of us to better each and every day. When it comes to living a spiritual life, and making those necessary improvements, we can learn a lot about who we were yesterday, who God wants us to be today, and how to make those changes that need to be made so that we are pleasing to Him.

item.title: Questions from Jesus - Why Do You Test Me?
item.description: As we read from Luke 20:20-26, we see the Pharisees and the Herodians approaching Jesus, pretending to be righteous, and asking Him one of the great burning questions of the day. "Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar or not?" Jesus' response to that question is awesome! Danny and Kurt will look at this question and really focus on the answer that Jesus gave to them and to us.

item.title: Show No Partiality
item.description: Showing Partiality is a very dangerous thing to do. Whether it's with our children, our friends, the rich, or the poor. God strictly forbids it in Scripture. Danny and Kurt will look at His instruction concerning righteous judgment and make the practical applications that can be found in this commandment of God.

item.title: Encouraging Words James 1:19-20
item.description: In James 1:19-20 the inspired writer tells us that we should be swift to hear, slow to speak, and slow to wrath. That can be a very difficult thing to do in certain situations. Danny and Kurt will discuss the meaning of this passage and how to apply it in daily life.

item.title: I Won't Serve an Angry God
item.description: Some people read about God's fierce anger in the Bible, and they are deeply troubled by what they see in Scripture. Danny and Kurt will discuss God's anger, and what we should be thinking about when we see these recorded episodes of fury and wrath. Why is God angry, why did He respond the way He did, and what am I supposed to take from all of this? A balanced approach to this topic will help us see and understand more about God and why He responds the way that He does.

item.description: In Philippians 4:8 Paul gives instruction to meditate on things that will help to strengthen us spiritually. With so many things to worry about and to be anxious about, this is such an encouraging passage to keep close to our hearts and minds as we strive to serve the Lord faithfully.

item.title: The Value of Wise Counsel
item.description: In Isaiah 9:6, the prophet gives a vivid description of the coming Messiah. He is called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, and Prince of Peace. Danny and Kurt will discuss the name, "Wonderful Counselor" and all that He has done for us. His counsel is perfect, always accurate, and it is freely given to us all.

item.title: Jesus, the Creator
item.description:
***Special note*** We apologize for the sound quality of this episode. We have made adjustments to ensure this won't happen again. Thank you so much for listening and for your patience!

Danny and Kurt look at the New Testament passages that clearly tell us that Jesus is the Creator and compare those verses to the Old Testament account of creation. How did Jesus create the heavens and the earth and what are the inplications of that truth?

item.title: Marriage Is Hard
item.description: In the beginning, God saw that it was not good for man to be alone. So, the Lord God of heaven made a helper comparable to him. Marriage is a divine ordinance of God and is sanctified by the Lord. If you're married for any time at all, you'll realize that marriage is hard. I need to learn to set my own wants and desires aside and make sure my wife is cared for the way God wants her to be cared for. That requires me to set myself aside and be all that she needs me to be. Marriage is hard.

item.description: Danny and Kurt hope to encourage you with this beautiful passage from God. He did not appoint us to wrath, but to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ. item.title: Worship In Spirit and In Truth
item.description: In John chapter 4, Jesus meets the Samaritan woman at the well and has an amazing conversation with her. When she asks the Lord about worship and the proper worship that is pleasing to God, Jesus tells her about a time that is coming upon them quickly. "The hour is coming, and now is, when the true worshippers will worship the Father in spirit and in truth; for the Father is seeking such to worship Him." John 4:23

item.title: Encouraging Words John 13:34-35
item.description: The world will recognize our discipleship in Christ by our love for one another. What an amazing statement from our Lord and Savior. Be encouraged by this time-tested truth love your brothers and sisters in Christ with all of your heart.

item.title: Questions from Jesus - Whose Image and Inscription Is This?
item.description: The Pharisees sent some of their disciples with the Herodians to ask Jesus if it was lawful to pay taxes. Jesus' response is so powerful for those who asked Him and for each one of us. These men gave the Lord a "yes or no" question and He did not answer them the way they wanted. Instead, He gave an answer that takes us away from the carnal and brings us into the spiritual. Hallelujah, what a Savior!

item.title: Encouraging Words 2 Corinthians 2:3-4
item.description: Paul wrote some very difficult things to the Corinthian church so that when he came to them, he would not be sorrowful. The worst thing that could ever happen to a Christian would be for them to lose of their faith and salvation. Paul doesn't want that for them, so he wrote what was necessary to help them turn back to the Lord. Today we hear Paul express that to them in his own words and by the inspiration of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: The Trials of Elijah
item.description: Elijah was a man with a nature like ours (James 5:17) and he experienced deep levels of depression and doubt. In this podcast, Danny and Kurt will look at Elijah, the situation that he is in, and what the Lord did for him so that he might continue the good fight of faith.

item.description: Our brother Kurt has just returned home from Vilnius, Lithuania and has some wonderful news to share with all of us. item.title: Encouraging Words Luke 18:1
item.description: Jesus spoke a parable to them, that men always ought to pray and not lose heart. The Lord has given us a way to speak directly to Him, knowing that when we pray, He hears us if we ask anything according to His will (1 John 5:14). It seems today that there are so many who have lost heart or don't think to pray to Him in their daily lives. Danny and Kurt want to encourage you and remind you to pray without ceasing. He is listening.

The Lord has given us a way to speak directly to Him, knowing that when we pray, He hears us if we ask anything according to His will (1 John 5:14). It seems today that there are so many who have lost heart or don't think to pray to Him in their daily lives. Danny and Kurt want to encourage you and remind you to pray without ceasing. He is listening.

item.title: Encouraging Words Ephesians 2:10
item.description: Our encouraging words are found in Ephesians 2:10 today. As Christians, we are told that we are the workmanship of God and that we are created in Christ Jesus for good works. God has prepared these good works beforehand so that we might walk in them. What a great way to look at our service to Him and the great purpose that is served when we do things the way He has intended.

item.title: The Soul Who Sins
item.description: Ezekiel 18:4 says, "The soul who sins shall die." Danny and Kurt will discuss this godly truth and what the Lord means when He says it. The father is not guilty for the son's sin and the son is not guilty of the father's sin. Equally true is the fact that the father's righteousness does not make the son righteous, and the righteousness of the son does not make the father righteous. Everyone is accountable for their own lives and their own actions.

item.title: Questions from Jesus - Why Do You Call Me Lord?
item.description: In Luke 6:46, Jesus asks the question, "But why do you call Me Lord, Lord, and not do the things which I say?" This question from Jesus is for those who are standing in front of Him, and it is also a question that reaches everyone who will ever hear it asked. Danny and Kurt will discuss this very important question and what it means for us today.

item.title: Ruth - Part 1
item.description: The book of Ruth is an amazing book that tells us of a time when there was no king in Israel and every man did what was right in his own eyes. Ruth stands out of that dark time as a shining example to all of us. Her faith in God, her love for Naomi, and her willingness to serve in a way that God has allowed. Danny and Kurt will consider this marvelous woman and discuss the lessons that are found in this short book.

item.title: Encouraging Words Genesis 50:19-21
item.description: In Genesis 50, Joseph was the second most powerful man in the world. When he was finally given the opportunity to repay his brothers who hated him and sold him onto slavery, he makes one of the humblest statements in all of Scripture. "You meant it for evil, but God meant it for good, to save many people alive."

item.title: David and Goliath
item.description: One of the most popular accounts in all of the Bible is the one concerning David and Goliath. Goliath is a Philistine champion from Gath, and he is a giant! David is a young lad from the house of Jesse, a Bethlehemite. These two will meet on the battlefield and change the course of two nations. In this episode, Danny and Kurt will look at this battle and consider the great lessons that God has for us here.

"Do you also want to go away?"

Danny And Kurt will look at this passage and discuss what it means for the Lord in His passion and for us today, as we watch Him give His life for the whole world that we all may see His love for us.

If we do not reverse our course as it concerns climate change, the destruction that is coming will be devastating to all humanity. In this episode, Danny and Kurt will look at these warnings and use the word of God to understand our place in all of this worldly concern.

item.title: The Joy of Trials
item.description: This is a title that needs some explaining. In this episode, Danny and Kurt talk about the difficult passage in James 1:2. "My brethren, count it all joy when you fall into various trials, knowing that the testing of your faith produces patience." We should count it as joy when we face the trials that come our way and yet that is very hard to do. James tells us that we know the testing of our faith produces patience.

item.description: In John's gospel, Jesus asks Peter three times, "Do you love Me?" Danny and Kurt look at this moment between the Lord and His apostle and discuss the question, its depth, and what it means for us.

item.title: The Voice of the Devil - Part 3
item.description: The third and final time we hear the voice of Satan is found in the gospels of Matthew and Luke. Jesus was led out into the wilderness by the Holy Spirit and fasted for forty days and forty nights. The tempter came to Him at that time and what He has to say to Jesus is recorded for us. Danny and Kurt will look at that important conversation between the father of lies and the Prince of Life and see what we can all learn from our Lord and Savior.

In this episode, Danny and Kurt talk about forgiveness, its beauty, and the challenges that present themselves when it's time to forgive in a godly way.

item.title: The Voice of the Devil - Part 2
item.description: The second time we hear the voice of the devil in Scripture is found in the first two chapters of the book of Job. When the devil spoke to Eve in Genesis 3, he accused God before man. This time he will go to God and accuse man before God. Jesus says this about the devil in John 8:44. "You are of your father the devil, and the desires of your father you want to do. He was a murderer from the beginning and does not stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks from his own resources, for he is a liar and the father of it."

item.title: God Has Chosen the Weak
item.description: Why did the Lord choose a young shepherd boy to go out and fight Goliath? Why did the Lord tell Gideon that three hundred men would be enough to defeat the Midianites who were numbered as the sand of the sea? Why was Jesus, the Son of God born in a manger and why did He grow up in the home of a carpenter in Nazareth? Because God has chosen the weak things of the world to put to shame the things that are mighty (1 Corinthians 1:27). In this episode, Danny and Kurt will discuss this amazing truth in God. He chooses the weak to defeat the mighty things of the world because no flesh shall glory in His presence (1 Corinthians 1:29).

He is a liar and a murderer from the beginning so we will start in Genesis chapter 3 where the devil speaks to Eve.

item.title: Discernment
item.description: Discernment is a very important word that is used in the Bible. As Christians, we are required by God to discern between good and evil. Danny And Kurt will look at this great responsibility that is enjoined upon us by God.

item.title: The Marshmallow Test
item.description: The Marshmallow Test is a psychological study that was first performed by Walter Mischel, a professor at Stanford University. These studies were done to test delayed gratification and was designed to follow the children into their adult years. Would these young children who could delay gratification at an early age have a better chance of being successful later in life? These studies found that the children who were willing to wait scored higher on their SAT's, had higher GPAs in college, and a higher annual income as adults. Danny and Kurt will consider these studies and discuss how delayed gratification is a part of God's will for our lives.

Let's go to God's word together and see what we can learn about this title, "The Son of Man".

item.description: Paul told Titus that he left him in Crete so that he could set in order the things that were lacking and appoint elders in every city (Titus 1:5). item.title: Questions from Jesus - The Baptism of John?
item.description: The chief priests, the scribes, and the elders approached Jesus during the last week of His life and asked Him two questions. Jesus responded by saying, "If you answer My question, I will tell you by what authority I do these things". Then He asked them about the baptism of John, is it from heaven or from men. What happens next reveals the hearts of the Pharisees and their unwillingness to tell the truth. Danny and Kurt will look at this moment in time and share their thoughts on what took place.

item.title: Deborah
item.description: Deborah was a prophetess, a psalmist, a military leader, and a judge! She is a magnificent character in the Bible, and she is used by God to free His people from Jabin, king of Canaan. The Israelites come to her for judgment, and they know that she is led by God.

item.title: At the Foot of the Cross
item.description: What lies at the foot of the cross? God's eternal love, the perfect and complete offering for our souls' salvation, and a determination from each one of us to give our lives to God. In this episode Danny and Kurt discuss the power of the cross and the influence it has on those who love and serve the Lord. "For I determined not to know anything among you except Jesus Christ and Him crucified." 1 Corinthians 2:2

item.title: Is Faith Blind?
item.description: It is often said that Christians have a blind faith. They can't explain what they believe so they just say, "I have faith". In this episode, Danny and Kurt will discuss their faith in God and how we should respond to the assumption that our faith is blind. Hebrews 11:1-3

item.title: Mephibosheth and Me
item.description: In this podcast, Danny and Kurt will look at the picture that is given to us in the life of Mephibosheth. As a direct descendant of Saul, he would normally be killed by the new king to keep him from claiming the throne to be his rightful place. David, the king, does not kill Mephibosheth but instead does something that surprises us all. This is a beautiful picture of our King and the way He feels about us.

item.title: How Can I Know That I Am Saved?
item.description: This episode is the second part to "How Does God Save Me." Many people in the world ask this very important question, "How can I know that I am saved?" and truly need a Biblical answer. Danny and Kurt provide the answer from God's word to help all of us know if we are saved.

item.title: How Does God Save Me?
item.description: In previous Common Sense Gospel episodes, Danny and Kurt have often said, "We only need the Bible to know how to please God and to be saved." Saying that the Bible has given us all we need to know for salvation is right, but it could be that not everyone knows what the Bible says about salvation or how an individual comes to the knowledge of the truth and is saved. In this episode, they will look at those important conditions that God has laid out for all those who will obey Him and serve Him faithfully.

item.title: Is the Body Complete
item.description: Christ is the head, and the church is the body. Ephesians 4:16 tells us that the whole body is joined and knit together by what every joint supplies, according to the effective working by which every part does its share, causing growth of the body for the edifying of itself in love. Danny and Kurt will address the question, "Is the Body Complete?" and look at the importance of the members of the Lord's body and their contribution to its effective working.

item.title: Is Being Good, Good Enough?
item.description: There are some fantastic people in this world who do a lot of good things in their lives. In this episode, Danny and Kurt talk about the good that we all have done, how God sees those deeds, and if it's enough to get us to heaven. If we are truly good people, but we have not obeyed the Son of God, will we go to heaven? John 14:6

item.title: The Temptress
item.description: The immoral woman is found many times in the book of Proverbs. We are warned about her in chapters 5, 6, 7, and 9. Danny and Kurt discuss chapter 7 and the way she seduces men. If he goes to her, he will lose his life. "For by means of a harlot a man is reduced to a crust of bread; And an adulteress will prey upon his precious life." Provers 6:26

item.title: Speaking as the Oracles of God
item.description:
"If anyone speaks, let him speak as the oracles of God." 1 Peter 4:11 

Danny Simmons and Kurt Norbut address three words that are commonly misused in the church today. They will give these three words, the meaning of these words, and the common misuses that are heard in the religious world today.

item.title: Thou Shalt Not!
item.description: You may have heard your preacher say, "Nine out of the ten commandments in the Old Testament are repeated in the New." Danny and Kurt will look into this claim and see which Old Testament commandments are repeated in the New Testament.

item.title: Shelter in the Storm
item.description: Faithful Christians are in the middle of a terrible storm. Sin is pressing in on all of us as we strive to serve the Lord. We should be encouraged to know that there is nothing new under the sun and we are not the first to deal with these kinds of problems. In this episode, Danny and Kurt will remind our listeners that our confidence in God is a powerful shelter that will not be moved. "For You have been a shelter for me, A strong tower from the enemy. I will abide in Your tabernacle forever; I will trust in the shelter of Your wings." Psalm 61:3-4

item.title: The Fruit of the Spirit
item.description: Jesus tells us in John 15:5 that He is the vine, and we are the branches. Those who abide in Jesus and He in them will bear much fruit, but without Him we can do nothing. Danny and Kurt will take a closer look at the spiritual fruit that we should all bear in our lives, to the glory of God.

item.title: Who Is Jesus?
item.description: In the Gospels Jesus asked one of the most important questions placed before humanity - "Who do you say that I am?". In this podcast Danny and Kurt look at the Biblical answer to this vital question.

item.title: Should Christians Celebrate Christmas?
item.description: In this episode, Danny and Kurt discuss Christmas as the observance of the birthday of Jesus. What does the Bible say and how should a Christian approach this time of year?
item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel

item.title: The Pain of Betrayal - *Return of Trivia Questions*
item.description:
Betrayal is probably one of the toughest things to endure when it comes to our friends and loved ones. In this episode, Kurt and Danny will look at the betrayal of Jesus and how He endured this tragic moment with Judas Iscariot. We will also consider the lessons we can take from our Savior as He has shown us how to handle betrayal in a godly way. 

*** Also, trivia questions are back! *** We have seen several requests to go back to the trivia question portion of our show and we are excited to do that with all of you again. This episode marks the return of the trivia questions!

item.title: The Power of Gratitude
item.description:
It's always nice to hear someone say thank you when we've done something for their benefit. In this episode, Danny and Kurt discuss the power of gratitude toward God and how being thankful is so good for us, the recipients of God's love, mercy, and grace. Being grateful for what God has done should always cause us to reciprocate His kindness to those around us because of the great blessings we have received from Him. 

Colossians 3:12-14

item.title: Sin, Who Cares?
item.description: Sin is an important word in the Bible that deserves our attention. It is on every page of Scripture in one way or another and it is the reason that we are separated from God (Isaiah 59:1-2). In this episode Danny and Kurt will discuss the way sin is portrayed in the Bible, what it does to us and to our precious souls, and the godly remedy for dealing with sin.

item.title: Gossip
item.description: Gossip is a way to share questionable information about someone else with others. It's very easy to get caught up in gossip or what people are saying about others but it is so painful to know that someone has been gossiping about you. the Lord doesn't want us to gossip. He wants us to follow Him and only speak the truth as He does. We'll tackle this tough topic, how to spot it, and how to avoid it in this episode.

item.title: Can I Stand Alone?
item.description: Social conformity is a very powerful thing and it can quickly lead us in a direction that God would not want us to go. In this episode, Kurt and Danny discuss the challenges of social conformity and how to make sure that we are doing all we can to stand in the truth and not where society says we have to stand. "Therefore take up the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand in the evil day, and having done all to stand." Ephesians 6:13

item.title: Praising the Glory of His Grace
item.description: As we read the Bible it becomes clear that we are to praise God with our lives. We are to praise Him in song and service. In Ephesians 1:4-6 Paul tells us that God has chosen us in Jesus Christ, having predestined us to adoption according to the good pleasure of His will, to the praise of the glory of His grace, by which He made us accepted in the beloved. Danny and Kurt talk about this statement and how amazing it truly is that we should praise the glory of His grace!

item.title: Who You Are Matters!
item.description: In Matthew 5:13-15 Jesus tells His disciples that we are the light of the world. Faithful servants of God should have a strong impact on the people around them. We have opportunities all around us to encourage as we strive to speak the truth in love (Ephesians 4:15). May God bless us richly as we look for and anticipate the opportunity to speak a kind word to someone who is weary.

item.title: When Doubt Arises
item.description:
Doubt is a very serious thing when it comes to our spiritual strength and our trust in God. Each one of us experiences doubt from time to time, but what should we do when it comes our way? Danny and Kurt explore this problem and the danger it poses to the believer.

You can contact us at commonsensegospel@yahoo.com

item.title: Drawing the Line
item.description:
There comes a time in a Christians life when they must Draw the Line against sin or possibly lose their life. Being ready for that difficult moment takes a conscious effort and determination to have an answer in your heart and mind before that great challenge comes and we must do what we know is right. Danny and Kurt will look at a few Scriptural examples of this and discuss the application for Christians today.

Contact us @ commonsensegospel@yahoo.com

item.title: So You Want to Preach?
item.description:
In this episode, Danny and Kurt discuss the challenges and potential pitfalls of having the desire to preach. This world is in desperate need of men who are willing to step into this work and share God's truth (2 Timothy 2:1-2). If you are considering this fulltime work, listen carefully to what these men have learned through the years. Their desire is to help you make a good decision for the glory of God.

Contact us with comments or questions @

commonsensegospel@yahoo.com

item.title: When You Are the Enemy
item.description:
When facing evil in this life, we are fighting a spiritual battle against principalities and powers in the heavenly places. Evil hates truth and when we stand in God's truth we will be accused of being the problem. In this episode, Danny and Kurt discuss the reality of this attack and how God expects us to deal with it.

Contact us with comments or questions @ commonsensegospel@yahoo.com

item.title: Bonus Session - How Jesus Deals With Sin - Kevan O'Banion
item.description: We are very excited to have Kevan O’Banion with us for this special podcast. Kevan preaches at Kings Ridge church of Christ in Lubbock, Texas. We’ll talk about two women in John’s gospel who were living in sin and how Jesus speaks to them and deals with their situation. We’ll also discuss how we can be more like Him. He is full of grace and truth. John 1:14

item.title: Why Are There so Many Churches?
item.description: Division is an unfortunate characteristic of modern Christianity. How can people with good intentions and an honest approach to the scripture come to starkly different conclusions about what the Church that Jesus built, the Church of the Bible, looks like? In this episode we discuss our plans to bring a series of podcasts comparing churches of today with the Church of scripture.
