item.title: The Good Samaritan
item.description: The story of the "The Good Samaritan", found in  Luke 10:25-37, is given by Jesus after he is questioned by a lawyer of the Pharisees on who is neighbor is. The lawyer may not have been at ease with the answer. Are you? Join us as we discuss.

item.title: Did Paul Change His Mind About Baptism?
item.description: What did Paul mean in 1 Corinthians 1:17, Christ did not send me not to baptize, but to preach the gospel... "? How can we reconcile this with the accounts of Paul in the book of Acts? This week we look at this question, as well as, what other scriptures tell us about baptism and its place in salvation.

item.title: Lessons from the Life of Paul the Apostle
item.description: This week we examine the Apostle Paul and what we can learn from the example of his character, his work, and his faith as recorded in scripture.

item.itunes:summary: This week we examine the Apostle Paul and what we can learn from the example of his character, his work, and his faith as recorded in scripture.

item.title: Transforming Our Minds
item.description: This week we discuss the challenge that Paul gives us to "not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind" (Romans 12:2): why it is vitally important, what the ultimate goal of it is, and how we can do it.
item.dc:creator: The Common Sense Gospel
item.itunes:summary: This week we discuss the challenge that Paul gives us to "not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind" (Romans 12:2): why it is vitally important, what the ultimate goal of it is, and how we can do it.

item.title: The Goodness and Severity of God
item.description: God's revelation of himself to us through the scriptures describes him as merciful and loving yet also wrathful and avenging. This is not a matter of contradiction, as some might claim, rather it is the reality of God's personality and a consequence of his holiness and righteousness. We'll examine this and more in this episode. Join us and consider the goodness and severity of God.

item.title: The Rich Man and Lazarus
item.description:
This week we finish up our series on parables with the teaching of The Rich Man and Lazarus. While considered a parable by some, it falls outside the normal parable structure in many ways. Join us as we discuss this lesson given by Jesus that gives us a glimpse into the next life and contrasts those who are rich in this life but without regard for their soul with those who are poor according to the things of the world but rich towards God.

You can find our website at https://www.thecommonsensegospel.com for more episodes and feel free to reach out to us at commonsensegospel@yahoo.com.

item.title: Hard Sayings of Christ
item.description:
This week we discuss three "hard sayings" of Christ that challenge us to live more holy and Godly lives. These sayings are difficult because they call us to a higher standard of living than what comes naturally. By studying these things, we may understand more the wisdom and love of God and obtain a Christ-like disposition towards others, letting the light of the gospel shine through us and bringing glory to God in so doing.

Visit our website at www.thecommonsensegospel.com or contact us at commonsensegospel@yahoo.com

item.title: What Can I Do?
item.description:
I’m just one person. Not many care about God’s word or His will accept those who are faithful to Him. How can I help? What can I do? What’s the best way to share the truth with the ones I love?

Consider a few Bible examples of what people did when they loved the Lord, trusted His word, and realized that He will bless their efforts to move according to His will.

item.title: Taking the Lord's Name in Vain
item.description:
The name of God become a common word in the eyes of the world, even being used in slangs and curses. Does this bother you? Join us today as we examine what the bible says about the Lord's name.

item.title: The Unseen World
item.description:
Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen. Join us as we discuss with a special guest what the bible reveals about the world that we cannot see.

Please visit our website at https://www.thecommonsensegospel.com for more episodes and feel free to reach out to us at commonsensegospel@yahoo.com. Our podcast is now available on Apple Podcasts, iTunes, Google Podcasts, Spotify, Breaker, Overcast, and Radio Public with more platforms coming soon.

item.title: I Hate Work
item.description:
According to a 2013 Forbes Magazine report, nearly 90% of the worlds workers are  unhappy with their current job. About 70% of American workers feel the same. There is a myriad of reasons for this serious problem, but the truth is, most people don't like their job. In this episode, Sam and Danny will address this difficult topic and discuss what God’s word has to say about it. If you are like so many other workers in the United States and you feel like screaming out, “I hate my job!” You would be well served to hear God’s will for your work life. 

Please visit our website at https://www.thecommonsensegospel.com for more episodes and feel free to reach out to us at commonsensegospel@yahoo.com. 

Our podcast is now available on Apple Podcasts, iTunes, Google Podcasts, Spotify, Breaker, Overcast, and Radio Public with more platforms coming soon.

item.title: Are We Still Under the Old Law?
item.description:
Are New Testament Christians still to keep the Law of Moses? Are we under law at all? Surprisingly,  you will be met with varied answers in the "Christian" world. So what does Scripture say about how faith, grace, and law intersect? 


Contact us with comments or questions at commonsensegospel@yahoo.com.

We now have a website at https://www.thecommonsensegospel.com/

Our podcast is now available on Apple Podcasts, iTunes, Google Podcasts, Spotify, Breaker, Overcast, and RadioPublic with platforms coming soon.

item.title: Entrusted with the Gospel
item.description: In our second episode we discuss why we began this podcast. We believe the Bible is the living word of God and through the knowledge of Jesus Christ we can be saved. We hope that by studying together we can come to a more complete understanding and unity in that knowledge.
